questions.question_text: True or False: The user has to specify which cluster a query will run on in a multi-cluster Warehouse.

discussion.content:

A user has to select a WAREHOUSE not a specific cluster within the warehouse.
B.false

B is correct

Selected Answer: B
Select the warehouse, not the cluster

comments.content: User can use warehouse, but doesn't need to specify cluster.. So False

discussion.content:

Answer: B

Selected Answer: B

Selected Answer: B
A user has to select only the VW, not a specific cluster within the VW.

questions.question_text: How does a Snowflake stored procedure compare to a User-Defined Function (UDF)?

choices.A: A single executable statement can call only two stored procedures. In contrast, a single SQL statement can call multiple UDFs.
choices.D: Multiple executable statements can call more than one stored procedure. In contrast, a single SQL statement can call multiple UDFs.
choices.C: A single executable statement can call multiple stored procedures. In contrast, multiple SQL statements can call the same UDFs.
choices.B: A single executable statement can call only one stored procedure. In contrast, a single SQL statement can call multiple UDFs.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Multiple UDFs may be called with one statement; 
A single stored procedure is called with one statement
A single SQL statement can call multiple UDFs.
A single SQL statement can call only one stored procedure.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/developer-guide/stored-procedures-vs-udfs
Multiple UDFs May Be Called With One Statement; a Single Stored Procedure Is Called With One Statement

B :
call proc1()
call proc2()
select udf1(), udf2() from table

Selected Answer: B
https://alexandersks.medium.com/difference-between-stored-procedures-and-udfs-snowflake-9e5b93cdb081

Selected Answer: A
A: Unload from Table to Named Stage : https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-unload-overview.

comments.content: The correct answer is A - The COPY INTO command is used to unload all the rows from a table into one or more files in a named stage in Snowflake.

discussion.content:

I assume a table is on local file system

questions.question_text: Which command should be used to unload all the rows from a table into one or more files in a named stage?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The COPY INTO command is used to unload all the rows from a table into one or more files in a named stage in Snowflake.
A is Correct

Selected Answer: A
Correct

questions.question_text: Which command is used to unload data from a table or move a query result to a stage?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
https://other-docs.snowflake.com/en/collaboration/consumer-becoming
Set Up Required Privileges

To access a listing, you must use the ACCOUNTADMIN role or another role with the CREATE DATABASE and IMPORT SHARE privileges. To pay for a paid listing, your role must also have the PURCHASE DATA EXCHANGE LISTING privilege.

Selected Answer: AB
I vote AB
https://other-docs.snowflake.com/en/collaboration/consumer-becoming#set-up-required-privileges
To access a listing, you must use the ACCOUNTADMIN role or another role with the CREATE DATABASE and IMPORT SHARE privileges. To pay for a paid listing, your role must also have the PURCHASE DATA EXCHANGE LISTING privilege.

Also see similar (but not identical Q592 - I spent a lot of time on that one and wasn't 100% sure what the right answer was).

Selected Answer: AB
AB are correct

Selected Answer: BC
The right answer is Import_Share and AccountAdmin roles. but in the absence of AccountAdmin, Ownership is the next higher role.

Answer is A & B
All roles with the IMPORT SHARE and CREATE DATABASE privileges can get and request data.
